revised_title: Preliminary Account of the Total Solar Eclipse of August 29, 1886
tldr: The author, Arthur Schuster, describes his observations and photographic recordings of the total solar eclipse of August 29, 1886. He discusses the challenges and limitations of capturing clear images of the corona and the potential improvements needed in telescope design and mechanical arrangements for better results. Schuster also shares his findings on the spectrum of the corona, identifying numerous lines that can be measured with fair accuracy.
